name: deimosrising
text: Best depiction of Hell since Dante.

name: gormster
text:
I especially like the roads. Reminds me of the various tunnels and motorways in the city.

I bet getting around Hell is really hard. All one-way roads, improperly signposted.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
wherever you're going, that's right where you are...
and nobody knows it but me.

name: gethen
text: I imagine it is like driving in the cambridge area for the first time.

name: greenkoolayd
text: like the damned ol' indian reservations in arizona(etc).

name: greenkoolayd
text: like the damned ol' indian reservations in arizona(etc).

name: catachresis
text: Serious, with the last arc and this one a whole new dimension of gnarly creepy artwork is added to Achewood. Fucking great, this.

name: senseihollywood
text: always suspected the Colonel was one of Satan's minions...

name: mysterymeat1001
text: You rang?

name: drskradley
text: He does put an addictive chemical in his chicken...

name: mysterymeat1001
text: They say that MSG stands for "Makes Stuff Good."

name: whuppins
text: This should be a lot closer to 5.

name: centipede_damascus
text: In Hell, the KFC is always open.

name: neoboman
text: And is adjacent to Taco Bell.

name: prolefeed5
text: There would be a Long John Silvers there too, but there only in the first circle of hell, not the seventh...

name: prolefeed5
text: I mean "they're". Dammit, I'm one of those people...

name: quantumcasaba
text: I am imagining that Ray bought one of those feed-trough 'bowls.' Only he probably ordered extra gravy and topped it off with an entire chicken breast.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Crap. Make that a bucket with a side of gravy in which to dip the chicken.
I'm the one who suuucks.

name: gamemeister27
text: I bet the KFC in hell is where the double down was created.

name: saurkraus
text: This would have to be my favourite speech-free strip.

name: shoinan
text: This strip reminds me of university :D

name: greymantledwolf
text: i like the idea of a kfc in hell, but i don't know why.

name: tekende
text: Me too. I like imagining that it's really expensive though, and there's no chicken fried steak meals on Wednesdays.

name: bixschmix
text: And they always leave out your fucking biscuit.

name: tekende
text: And they have livers and gizzards like in Arkansas.

name: carlyle
text: I always thought it would be free, but the place is empty, and only static greets you at the ordering speaker. All the lights are on, and the stoves and fryers are on too, but you see no food and there is no there. When you sit in a booth you feel the overwhelming feeling of being watched by something your mind is incapable of imagaining. When you go to the bathroom you are so overcome with fear you cry. If the lights turn out they won't turn on again.

name: nickb285
text: I'm not entirely sure why, but that last sentence terrified me.

name: notowen
text: The rocky outcropping in panel 2 looks like a fat man's gnarled nipples.

name: zedpower
text: Oh God, I see it too now.

name: aarongstock
text: May this relieve you: the rocky outcropping above Ray's car in panel 1 looks like part of a nude woman's body.

name: dovey
text: I'm trying to work out if it's the front or back

name: aarongstock
text: Front, from below the ribcage to above the knee.... I thought maybe I should have been more specific.

name: soticoto
text:
Onstad did it deliberately y'know.
Hell is closed vadge and many moobs.

name: epicurus
text: Fuck you.

name: drskradley
text: Dammit dammit dammit it's taken this strip somewhere it shouldn't.

name: joeyvig
text: hehehehehe

name: electricjelly
text:
Look how classy Ray is.

He drives through hell, all smooth and calm. Not a single sign of fear in his face, nor excitement. He looks left, looks forward... interested, yes. Dignified curiosity behind his Versace glasses.

This is Ray. Ray is classy.

name: killingthejay
text: except he's eating KFC

name: ham_shoes
text: Hell is apparently a pretty casual place where you can just drop in, hang out, do what you need and then leave

name: pitseleh
text: The kicker is when you try to order anything you actually want, they're all out . The worst part of it all is....all the biscuits are STALE. Or is it the Pepsi? Man, I fucking hate Pepsi.

name: sex_bicycle
text: lol you're picture goes so well with this i can imagine philippe getting so pissed off about stale biscuits and pepsi instead of the real stuff in hell i bet philippe went to hell for killing bambis mother (see don't even need to name it! pepsi will never be good enough for the real stuff) lol

name: small
text: Last 2 times I had KFC I sat on the toilet all night with the Jimmy Smits. Never again.

name: spinynorman
text: Sure they weren't pimp skitters?

name: epicurus
text: I wonder if it costs money at the KFC? How do businesses in Hell operate, I wonder?

name: presterjohn
text: I imagine hell has excellent buy-on-credit opportunities. The passenger seat of that Brat was just littered with pre-approved Discover cards and such.

name: tekende
text:
You get it on credit
But you have no way of making any money, ever

And every day the creditors call you
they ask when you will make a payment
this happens every day

And you can't make that payment

name: epicurus
text: That actually sounds about right.

name: fineoakstructure
text: And you can't commit suicide, because you're in Hell.

name: cousinted
text:
And down in the ground
you grow horns and a tail
and you carry a fork
and mold away!

name: gitarooman
text: *burn away

name: eatmorekix
text: man i'm so jonesing for some fried chicken.

name: laserblade
text: Hell actually looks manageable.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: So I guess Ray isn't vegetarian for this arc after all?

name: tekende
text:
Who's going to bother after they're dead?

I mean, besides Pat.

name: kelissamunz
text: This is definitely a Hell I'd be curious to check out.

name: direhaggis
text: Going vegan helped get Ray down to Hell that much quicker, so he has no problem grabbing a bucket of Colonel and a pint of dippin' gravy.

name: zedpower
text: Joke's on Ray. This is actually Kentucky Fried Cacodemon.

name: skaterpix
text: Everyone says hell would be bad! But you get a car to drive around in, a spiffy hat and there is a KFC

name: deusoma
text: I'm not sure why they gave Ray a car. I mean, whenever I drive in my car I have this strange sense of "protected-ness" like it's made out of tank armour or something and nothing outside can hurt me. You'd think they wouldn't want that feeling in Hell.

name: ishuta
text: it's so when something horrible does happen to you, it's unexpected

name: ishuta
text: this strip is perfect achewood

name: radarjammer
text: Hell isn't so bad, apparently. A lot better than my town.

name: mikestan
text:
Two excellent things about Onstad's vision of hell:

1. Drive through KFCs.
2. Hell reminds me of the Underworlds in Super Mario Bros.

name: puguglypress
text: Ray ain't concerned.

name: ham_shoes
text: I imagine the sound of yodeling reverberating around the hellish chasms as Ray blithely cruises around.  Because his hat smacks of Cliffhanger from The Price is Right.

name: aseidel
text: who wouldnt?
